Gioca le tue carte avvenimento, sorprendi i tuoi avversari, ingaggia l'allenatore, completa lo stadio e otterrai la vittoria.
Families: Game: BEST 11 Board Game – Il Gioco dei Campioni

Name: Breakthrough: Tanks
Description:
Breakthrough is a strategy game where two tank armies fight each other. The goal of the game is to be the first to reach the other end of the board (break through the enemy’s frontline). It has some similarity to Checkers, but the strategy is completely different.

Each team consists of the following units:
2 heavy tanks
4 tank destroyers
10 medium tanks

The game is played with 1:200 scale models. A blue German army fights against a green Soviet one.

—description from the designer

Name: Feindbild: Das Kartenspiel
Description:
The world is very confusing. It's good if you then have a clear picture of the enemy! Stage your image of the enemy with the right campaign for the right target group and clear away the image of the enemy in a politically correct manner.

"Feindbild" ("Enemy stereotype") - this is a unique game concept in which the fun of the game scratches the satire. The game can be explained in a few minutes. But you can play it for years. Provided, of course, that our enemy stereotypes do not change by then.

Every player gets a target group to work for. Then five images of the enemy are laid out. And then it is important to stage the enemy images with the right media campaign in such a way that the anger of your own target group begins to boil. And that's about it. Isn't it nice when card games can be explained so easily?

As enemy images there are the bad Russians, the classic terrorists, the scruffy social parasite, the greedy pharmaceutical industry and the corrupt European politician. And of course many more. The target groups are the conservatives, the left and the right and of course the totally confused aluminum hat wearers. And as campaigns there is the regulars' table, the focus on television and the daily press. And of course the satirical portals themselves. That closes the circle.

As is usual with card games, you have to spend money on "Feindbild" in order to play it. Yes, we live in evil capitalism. Another enemy image. The game consists of 106 cards, which consist of 18 enemy images, 8 target groups and 80 campaigns. And there are also instructions for use.

Name: Odkrywcy: Sahara
Description:
Journey to distant Africa. Discover hot desert, life giving river Nil and hidden in the sand Oasis. Meet incredible animals, which lives there. Don't be fooled by mirages and remember about magic talismans, which can change Your faith.

This is a simple square tile placing game where each corner can have a different color which have to match when placing the tiles next to one another. Players score immediately after placing their tile and moves their pawn on scoring track based on the number of connecting animals with additional points matching animal kind, plus star symbols.
Each player has set of special tokens allowing unique actions. After using special action mysterious oasis tile is added to the game by the active player. To reveal it needs to be surrounded from all sides. When flipped over it adds or reduces points based on animals around it - whenever it turns out to be a mirage or actual oasis.

Name: Razorhurst
Description:
Sydney, Australia in the 1920s is a hotbed of crime and vice. The inner city suburbs of Darlinghurst and Surrey Hills are a battleground between warring gangs led by prostitute Tilly Devine and sly grog queen Kate Leigh. And in the middle of it all is you, a detective for the New South Wales Police, just trying to solve the crimes and bring the perpetrators to justice.

Razorhurst is a story-driven detective game similar to Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective. You will interview suspects, follow leads, and use your abilities for observation, persuasion and force. Razorhurst introduces a unique clock mechanic for affecting the player's abilities. But the main difference with other detective games is that in Razorhurst everything is real. You will be investigating actual crimes, tracking down historical evidence, and bringing actual killers to justice. Based on exhaustive research, Razorhurst allows the player to step back in time to one of the most heady and deadly places in history.

—description from the designer

Name: Einkaufen macht Spass!
Description:
In this game, the children playfully learn the first quantities and numbers related to shopping.

Each player gets a list which things to shop in a supermarket.
On your turn, you roll the dice and advance as many steps in the supermarket. If you end in front of a shelf in which you find one of the things from your shopping list, you have to name the shelf and the number of things on your list. For example: "I'm standing in front of the fruit shelf and I'm taking three bananas." If you named everything correctly, you're allowed to put the corresponding token on your shopping list.

The player who completes his or her shopping list first, wins.

Name: Kanban EV: Upgrade Pack
Description:
This pack contains two separate expansions:

The SpeedCharger Expansion provides players with persistent special abilities they may pay shifts to unlock.

The Special Garage Tile Expansion consists of seven special garage tiles.

Name: Ambush!: A Fast-Paced Game of Strategy and Sacrifice
Description:
Ambush is a fast-paced, fantasy-themed strategy card game with exciting, dynamic gameplay centered around a cast of colorful characters with different abilities. Ambush seeks to provide the perfect blend of thrilling action and intense strategy in a game where the tide of battle can be turned in the blink of an eye! Take control of your personal castle and craft the perfect army of goblins, wizards, and knights to attack your opponents and defend your own walls from harm. The goal of the game is to be the last castle standing at the end of the hectic free-for-all.

To do this, players will need to plan and strategize for the Ambush phase, where any card played in the game so far is up for grabs in a mad scramble that has a chance to be triggered at the start of every player’s turn. Having the speed and reflexes to grab the best cards first, as well as remembering where the best cards are on the field will be critical in obtaining the upper hand over other players.

Ambush was created as a project for a USC Games class in the fall of 2019 by Michael Ford, Brendan Tighe, Masato Lin, and Tongwei Dai. The team saw some incredible potential in the game, and in the Spring of 2020,a portion of the group reformed and set out to publish and sell the game with the help of USC faculty and developers from other board game start-ups.

—description from the designer

Name: Pocket Paragons: AEGIS
Description:
Each player chooses a paragon and takes their deck of 7 unique cards. Every turn, players choose a card from their hand and play them simultaneously.  Both cards are revealed and then characters either take damage, have their card canceled and sent back to their hand, or are defeated. Play the right card at the right time and have a strong read of your opponent's intentions to win!

This box features 6 characters from the world of AEGIS. Featuring Poppet, Stell, Ixa, Gamound, Etwal, and Ainer

—description from the publisher

Name: Pocket Paragons: Temporal Odyssey
Description:
Each player chooses a paragon and takes their deck of 7 unique cards. Every turn, players choose a card from their hand and play them simultaneously.  Both cards are revealed and then characters either take damage, have their card canceled and sent back to their hand, or are defeated. Play the right card at the right time and have a strong read of your opponent's intentions to win!

This box features 6 characters from the world of Temporal Odyssey. Featuring Mr. F, DeMattei, Zane, 413X, Christina, and Rowan

—description from the publisher

Name: Pocket Paragons: Rivals of Aether
Description:
Each player chooses a paragon and takes their deck of 7 unique cards. Every turn, players choose a card from their hand and play them simultaneously.  Both cards are revealed and then characters either take damage, have their card canceled and sent back to their hand, or are defeated. Play the right card at the right time and have a strong read of your opponent's intentions to win!

This box features 6 characters from the world of Rivals of Aether. Featuring Zetterburn, Orcane, Kragg, Wrastor, Clairen, Ranno. Characters in this box feature an additional special move instead of a block ability. Use your additional ability to control your opponents!

—description from the publisher

Name: Rulebreaker
Description:
The main rule is to follow the rules, but to win you’re probably going to have to break them!     REBEL WITH A CAUSE...be the first to discard all the cards in your hand.  As many as you want.  As fast as you want.  All you have to do is lay them in numerical order...subject to the RULES.  You see, as you play, your discards are always subject to certain RULES.  Chance upon a RULEBREAKER card, and shake things up with a new RULE!  Are you winning?  Are you losing?  Always too soon to tell.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dungeon Flee
Description:
The dungeon deck consists of 104 cards representing six dungeon levels, monsters, treasures, traps, doors, empty corridors, dead ends and stairs up.  While exploring a nearby dungeon, you found a horde of monsters planning something big for your nearby village. You were attacked and fell off a ledge in to the void. Left for dead by the monsters, you now have to make your way out of the dungeon and back to your village. You have no ideas where you are or how to get out but you have to escape and your are running out of time. Each corridor you take could lead you closer to the exit or directly into a dead end. Keep running and if you hit a dead end turn around and continue running. You can't stop and you must escape.  Each turn presents new dangers and possible treasures.  If you can survive long enough to make it through four stairs up you escape the dungeon alive.    Take too long or hit too many dead ends and you may never make it out alive.

—description from the designer

Name: BattleCON: Unleashed
Description:
BattleCON: Unleashed is the storage box you've been waiting for. At 17x13x8.5" (approx. 43x33x21cm) this box is being built to hold up to 110 fighter tuckboxes, a game board, and rulebook.

In addition to a big storage box for your fighters, Unleashed comes with tuckboxes and base sets to bring BattleCON: War and BattleCON: Fate up to the high component standard set in Trials. In total, it includes:
30 tuckboxes (for all fighters from Fate and War, plus Borneo and Juto)
30 extra Base sets (for all fighters from Fate and War, plus Borneo and Juto—Force Special Actions are included)
~95 cards to Update Fate, War, and Trials
All stretch and social goal content unlocked during the campaign.

Unleashed includes ten solo fighters (Anath, Andrus, Claus & Wyndhal, Dolores, Eliza, Evil Hikaru, Lucius, Rheye, Takeshi, Victor), and another four solo fighters (Jin, Merjoram, Oriax, Raritti) were available as an add-on during the Kickstarter campaign. One additional solo fighter (Himel) was made available in the Empyreal: Far Corners Pledge Manager alongside the Grand Chronicle and errata cards for BattleCON: Unleashed.

Name: BattleCON: Oriax Two Godhacker
Description: Oriax’s deity cards grant small boons when first invoked, and then more powerful boons after they begin to run out. These devastating effects are limited, however, and Oriax must be careful not to invoke their power too freely or lightly.

Name: The Museum Village 19th Century Americana Tour Game
Description:
A roll and move game for two to four people.The goal is to strategically move your pawns such that they share specific spaces in order to gain a souvenir card. This is done by rolling one die on your turn and moving one of your two pawns. The path recreates that of Old Mmuseum Village of Smith's Clove, a mile west of the Village of Monroe,  NY., opened in 1950. The game ends when all pawns have reached the end of the path. The player with the most tickets is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Save the Queen!
Description:
"Our new Queen is finding us a new home after her statement with her rival. As a member of her royal guard, we must protect her. The problem is she is so fast and always finds her way into trouble!"

Save the Queen!

In Save the Queen! you are a royal guard sent to protect the Queen Bee as you search for a new home. Defeat other insects as you compete for territories, but bee careful; you only have so much nectar and so much time to get to a new home before the colony dies.

Combat is based on hopping over opponents, like solitaire or checkers, with the addition of special abilities. Navigate through cards valued between 1 and 3 territories, with increased difficulty for each value.

—description from the publisher

Name: Power Void
Description:
"The Monarch has died and has left a Power Void; splitting the Factions.
“Which Faction will reign supreme?"

In Power Void, you must seek the demise of your foes through murder, suggestion, and fratricide, to become the next Monarch.

Combat is based on hopping over opponents, like solitaire or checkers, with the addition of special abilities. Each game is randomized thanks to the use of a bag.

Files can be found at:
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1_UVhvIP_WAWMJe4Q8Q6KOgMf9XdSxYkp?usp=sharing

Name: Here to Slay: Warriors & Druids Expansion
Description:
Warrior and Druid classes join the fray in this Here to Slay expansion. This expansion introduces new party leaders, heroes, and dangerous monsters! The Warrior class is headed by The Piercing Howl, a wolf that grants +1 to your roll for each item equipped to a Hero card in your Party. The Druid class, on the other hand, is headed by The Noble Shaman, a stag that allows you to channel the powers of the forest to deduct any player's roll by 1 once during each player's turn.

Contents:

    31 standard-sized cards
    2 oversized Party Leader cards
    2 oversized Monster cards


- description from the publisher

Name: Virallinen MM 97 jääkiekkopeli
Description:
The Official 1997 ICE Hockey World Championship game. It is tactical dice driven game for two players.

It has all the main elements of ice hockey. More goals and some times set wins achieved player wins the game. There is also possibility to the stalemate.

Players try to make more goals than opponent. Game is played in special icehockey looking game board with different symbols and places for five icehockey players and goalkeeper in each team. Also board has movement symbols which are used by turns depending to dice rolls. There is some randomness with hidden marks in game board that players try to find. This are shot, missed shot, tackle, offside, break, block, empty, goal , set win and joker.

Name: Band Grab
Description:
Band Grab is a fast-paced music-themed strategy card game where players race to collect a winning set of groovy musician cards for their band.
Players can steal band members, recruit powerful supporters and play game-changing event cards along their journey to playing their band's first gig. But to play a gig, a player's band must first contain musician cards with enough matching genre icons.
While the simple structure of this card game is easy-to-learn for a wide range of ages and abilities, there is plenty of scope for careful scheming, tense retaliation and varied replayability!

—description from the designer

Name: Це Бізнес Крихітка
Description:
Ð¦Ðµ Ð‘Ñ–Ð·Ð½ÐµÑ ÐšÑ€Ð¸Ñ…Ñ–Ñ‚ÐºÐ° ("This is Business Baby") is a board game with unique mechanics for those who want to learn financial literacy, improve their time management skills, and plunge into the world of entrepreneurship.

The game has a completely unique methodology and is based on the "win-win" strategy, where the most important thing is not victory, but the analysis of your actions during the game and interaction with other players.

In a playful way, you:

     learn about the methods of earning;
     organize your own business;
     get the necessary skills to start your own business;
     understand the importance of the resource of time;
     train your creative thinking skills;
     make your dream come true.

Name: Snowball
Description:
The game is played on an 8x8 board. There are two players: White and Blue. Each player has 16 Discs that are arranged on their second and third rows, respectively.

A Disc moves by taking a single step in any direction to an empty space. A Disc may also hop over a single, friendly piece to the empty space just beyond. But it may not hop over an enemy piece.

A Disc captures enemy pieces by withdrawal. This means if a Disc begins its turn with an enemy Disc adjacent, it may take a single step backwards, in the opposite direction, to the empty space just behind it. The enemy Disc is then removed from the board.

For its first turn, White makes one move, followed by Blue making two moves; White then makes three moves, and so on – creating a “Snowball Effect” of moves.

The player who eliminates all of his opponent’s pieces wins.

-description from designer

Name: Brainbox: Sport
Description:
Did you know table tennis has 300 million players worldwide? Or that the first Rugby World Cup was won by New Zealand? This BrainBox includes fascinating facts about almost every sport you have heard of and maybe a few you haven’t!

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a dice. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept, and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

Contents: 71 cards, 2 rules cards, 1 sand timer and 1 dice. Packed in a sturdy cool magnetic cube box.

Name: Warfighter Shadow War: Expansion #57 – General Soleimani
Description:
Target: Soleimani

Qasem Soleimani was a general in Iran's Revolutionary Guard Corps, and the commander of the elite Quds Force, a unit responsible for international covert ops. Due to his terrorist activities, Soleimani was sanctioned by the United Nations and European Union, and designated a terrorist by the United States. Under Soleimani's command, the Quds Force was responsible for killing hundres of US service members with IED attacks and ambushes.
You now have the mission to take out this clear and present danger to US forces in the region. This expansion provides you with several mission profiles to choose from to accomplish this vital mission. Good hunting!

—description from the publisher

Name: The Cannabis Trip: The Chilled Spliff Rolling Game
Description:
The first player throws the dice and moves onto the board starting at the central YELLOW HUB SPACE.
Players travel in a clockwise direction around each leaf in any order they wish and when they have collected all five spliffs they make their way to the BIG SPLIFF SPACE.
Whichever player arrives there first with all five spliff cards, forming a complete spliff is the winner.

Name: Inventor Gadgets
Description:
A card based party game where you combine object and feature cards to create a wacky new invention. You then pitch your invention to the group in hopes to advance your invention to the next round.

Each round you can play the role of the inventor, the buyer, and the marketing agent. During each role you may contribute an additional function, a slogan/catch phrase, or market to a specific target audience.

Each successful contribution may award you royalty money.

In the end the inventor with the most investment capital wins.

A wacky, multi-player party game of outlandish on-the-spot creativity.

Name: Avocadogs
Description:
A fast paced game of pun decoding chaos. Each card is a pun pairing two words to create something never before seen. With one pocket-sized, pub-friendly set of cards you can battle your friends in four different ways. The games vary in length, complexity and wildness to suit your every mood.
Each card combines 2 of 6 categories: animals, food, vehicles, body parts, clothing and places
Game 1: Juicy. Players must collect the most sets by picking up cards from the draw pile and stealing from their competitors in turn. Sets can be 5 cards with a single category match or 3 cards with a double category match 
Game 2: Natter. A team based party game where players must describe the characters without using any of the words on the card. Followed by rounds using a single word description, and then acting
Game 3: Throwdown. A race to get rid of your cards, by matching one of the categories on your card to one of the piles on the table. Getting a double category match freezes your competitors in place for 5 seconds whilst you continue to play.  
Game 4: Ransack. The fastest game option, a set collection game where all players can steal from each others hands whilst other cards continuously appear on the table. The player to collect the most sets of matching category cards wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Steamrolled
Description:
A game for all types of gamers. Roll custom dice and move your Steampunk inspired wooden pawn onto a betting track. Move up and including your dice roll to maneuver your pawn into a pot winning position or block your opponents from taking the pot.

2 solitaire versions, 4 different variations to play.

For 1-8 players with the ability to add as many players as you want with your own tokens. Each round takes 5-10 minutes and players play as many rounds as they like, or as determined by a dice roll.

—description from the publisher

Name: Atlantis Rising: Monstrosities
Description:
The gods will spare no effort to destroy Atlantis. From the hidden depths of the world they have called forth unspeakable terrors, monsters sent to destroy, frighten, and harry the Atlantean effort to save their civilization. But hope is not lost. On Atlantis, as new leaders rise up to answer the challenge, new powers also emerge to save the isle. And the gods have summoned a power even they cannot control, for some of these creatures are more sympathetic to Atlantis than to the cruel and petty gods.

Atlantis Rising: Monstrosities is an expansion for Atlantis Rising (Second Edition) that offers these new challenges:


     Medusa Unleashed, in which the gorgon Medusa turns Atlanteans to stone. Can you break her curse and recruit her to your side?
     The Harpies’s Lair, in which three monstrous, birdlike creatures steal the resources and workers you need to build the Cosmic Gate. Can you defeat the Harpies and win back the treasures found in their lair?
     Between Scylla & Charybdis, in which the monsters that have long doomed sailors leave their narrow straight and terrorize the shores of Atlantis. Can you satisfy their hunger and calm the waters surrounding the isle?


Four new mechanisms are introduced to the game:


     Monsters
     Allies
     Magic Items
     Locations


-description from publisher

Name: Honey Scouts
Description:
It's the annual spring moon, and the hive is abuzz with excitement. The Honeyscout Tournament is open, and every bee is preparing to battle it out for the top prize. As the Chief Honeyscout of your team, uncover locations of fields of flowers and get worker bees to swarm to treasure troves of nectar you have discovered. Get ready for the buzz of your life!

In HoneyScouts, you place hex tiles to match colors (essentially building the hive), and every time you match a color, you draft a card that gives the location of a flower, with the number indicating the distance between you (the bee) and the flower. When you match colors on the hive to create a complete hexagon of one color, you attract a bee to your swarm.

Why do the numbers on the cards matter? Because the game contains a trick-taking mechanism in which you can win bee battles and attract all the bees from an opponent, poaching them to your side. Special tiles and event cards can throw you off balance or be used to your advantage.

In the end, the player who attracts the most bees wins.

Name: Passport To The Hood Volume_01
Description:
The 1st of 3 volumes. 
The game that highlights stereotypes of urban culture, says everything that you hear behind closed doors and reflects on how you grew up. 
You are ready to play this game if you know: 
1) What to do when you see people run 
2) A New Yorker’s favorite word 
3) What snitches get 
4) What the PJ’s mean 
5) What not to do at a cookout. 
The objective of the game is to not lose points by predicting what answers the opposing teams will select.

Comes with 4 Passports, a gold box, 78 trivia cards (categories: THUG Life (8), Entertainment (20), Lifestyle (42), History (8)).

Instructions: 
Pick a host responsible for reading cards and keeping score. Form three or more teams and give them one set of A, B, C, D Decision cards. 
Teams show Decision cards at the same time. 
Cards with Facts (24) have answers captured in bold. Cards with Majority Vote (54) can only have one A, B, C, D answer. Teams that tie on Majority Vote cards don’t lose a point. 
The majority vote determines the answer. 
All of the above is not a valid answer. 
Teams start with 10 points and lose a point for incorrect answers. The last team with points wins and gets a Passport To The Hood.

—description from the publisher

Name: Passport To The Hood #Trap Edition
Description:
The 2nd of 3 volumes. 
Funny – AF no artificial flavors or colors. 
The game that highlights stereotypes of urban culture, says everything that you hear behind closed doors and reflects on how you grew up. 
You are ready to play this game if you know: 
1) The type of car dope boys drive 
2) What to do if you get hit in school 
3) How many times to reuse chicken grease 
4) How to play spades 
5) How to survive prison. 
The objective of the game is to not lose points by predicting what answers the opposing teams will select. 
Comes with 4 Passports, a pink box, 78 trivia cards (categories: Trap (21), Entertainment (26), Lifestyle (23), History (8)), plays up to 24 people.

Instructions: 
Pick a host responsible for reading cards and keeping score. Form three or more teams and give them on set of A, B, C, D Decision cards. 
Teams show Decision cards at the same time. 
Cards with Facts (32) have answers captured in bold. Cards with Majority Vote (46) can only have one A, B, C, D answer. Teams that tie on Majority Vote cards don’t lose a point. 
The majority vote determines the answer. 
All of the above is not a valid answer. 
Teams start with 10 points and lose a point for incorrect answers. The last team with points wins and gets a Passport To The Hood.

—description from the publisher

Name: Passport to The Hood #Feds Watching
Description:
The 3rd of 3 volumes. 
The game that highlights stereotypes of urban culture, says everything that you hear behind closed doors and reflects on how you grew up. 
You are ready to play this game if you know: 
1) The best song to start a fight in the club 
2) The first thing people do when they get out of jail 
3) The type of car to get racially profiled in 
4) What’s the best HBCU. 
The objective of the game is to not lose points by predicting what answers the opposing teams will select.

Comes with 4 Passports, a blue box, 78 trivia cards (categories: Feds Watching (18), Entertainment (12), Lifestyle (45), History (3)).

Instructions: 
Pick a host responsible for reading cards and keeping score. Form three or more teams and give them one set of A, B, C, D Decision cards. 
Teams show Decision cards at the same time. 
Cards with Facts (24) have answers captured in bold. Cards with Majority Vote (54) can only have one A, B, C, D answer. Teams that tie on Majority Vote cards don’t lose a point. 
The majority vote determines the answer. 
All of the above is not a valid answer. 
Teams start with 10 points and lose a point for incorrect answers. The last team with points wins and gets a Passport To The Hood.

—description from the publisher

Name: Roach Party
Description:
Roach Party is a fun party board game that mimics the lifestyle of an everyday pot smoker. What many may not know is this game has been around for a long time and you really never hear anything about it.

It was originally released in 1979, right after Cheech & Chong’s first movie, Up in Smoke. Roach Party was sold in head shops when they began popping up in the 80’s. It had great success, sold thousands of copies and was even featured in High Times Magazine. All was good until feds started raiding the shops and merchandise was seized, thus resulting in the disappearance of this really awesome stoner game.

The object of the game is to be the first player to accumulate a COMPLETE STASH. This is done by collecting all four of the ROACH CARDS. These include the BAGGIE, PAPERS, FIRE, and SUPPLIER cards.
Lastly you must acquire the funds to pay your supplier. Once you have all four cards and the funds required pay your supplier, you are the winner of Roach Party.

Name: Fair Game
Description:
Roll a set of colored dice trying to match combinations on the cards. Be the first to make a combination, and it's Fair Game to take a card -- from the center or from other players. First to collect 4 cards wins the game.

Contents:
24 Dice (4 Sets of 6)
26 Combination Cards
Instructions

Name: The Story Of My Life: A Trivia Game For Women
Description:
The Story Of My Life: A Trivia Game For Women

A fun-filled journey highlighting the social, personal and cultural experiences that cultivate the life stories of women.

Play this game and find out what stories you have in common with your friends.

—description from the publisher

Name: Nevermind The Distraction
Description:
The Mind is a Terrible Thing to Chase…

We spend so much time inside our heads, we often fail to see the world around us clearly. Only by slowing down, noticing our minds have distracted us and letting go can we truly experience life in its purest form.

Nevermind The Distraction is a short, fast-paced, yet surprisingly relaxing abstract solitaire card game inspired by the principles of mindfulness and beginning meditation. Take on the role of The Watcher and engage your own mind in a contest of wills to determine the ultimate fate of your wandering thoughts. Breathe, and try not to get too distracted!

Setup begins by preparing the meditating consciousness using small decks called Distraction Packs. These themed packs contain beautiful and evocative imagery depicting various occurring thoughts. Three packs are combined each game based on your mood, thoughts, or plans for the day, creating a unique visual tableau every session.

Each round starts with the Mind revealing a new thought - or intensifying an existing one - ultimately trying to turn them into Distractions. Distractions cause time to pass more quickly, and when the Timer deck is empty, the mediation is over!  The Mind’s ultimate goal is to waste time keeping us distracted as long as possible.

During the Watcher phase, players choose one of these thoughts and take an action to calm or quiet it, pulling it one step back from becoming a Distraction. Do this enough times and a thought is eventually Let Go, releasing it completely and blocking the Mind’s ability to manipulate it. The player’s goal is to Let Go of as many thoughts as possible before the Timer deck runs out.

What follows is an engaging, fast-paced yet relaxing 8-way Tug of War that, when combined with the beautiful minimalist aesthetic, create the perfect conditions for the player to enter a flow state, not unlike that of meditation.

Regular practice will eventually result in a perfect score. These “Zen Master” wins unlock additional levels of game play and introduce new challenges, mechanics and strategies letting the game grow with you.

The short play time, small box and limited table space needed make this an excellent addition to any daily self-care routine regardless of whether or not you practice meditation!

—description from the designer

Name: The Powers That Be
Description:
The time is now for dark secrets to come to light. The world is in chaos and only an elite few know the truth behind the scenes. There is an invisible and powerful force working in the shadows, manipulating the masses to control our world.

Playing as a global elite ruler in 2020, in this hybrid, deck-building / worker placement game, you must first build your cabal by acquiring assets. Then, use your best strategy to attack your enemies and successfully stage events on the global scale. Your goal is to stay invisible, while gaining power over the masses using your best strategy and card based, dice battles.

The winner is the first player to enter the "eye in the triangle" with 13 power points, where you rule the world and no one knows you exist.

The board works like a clock from above, with three dice rolled simultaneously to move the 3 main Board Pieces. The lower level of the board contains the assets, the middle level holds the special cards and the top, zodiac level is for pyramid activation, betting and scoring.
 Do you have what it takes to reach the top
of the pyramid and become, The Powers That Be?

—description from the designer

Name: Bye Bye Virus
Description:
INTRODUCTION: There is a virus outbreak in town. Stay safe against virus exposure by dealing with real-life situations. The deck has 3 types of cards: Protect cards, Panic cards, and Power cards.

SETUP: Choose your Deck depending on the number of players. 3 to 3 players, use the Green Deck only while for 4 to 6 players, use the Green and Blue Deck. Shuffle the Deck and place it face down on the table. As you play, throw cards face-up into the Discard pile. HOW TO PLAY: Players start with no cards. Choose any player to start and continue in a clockwise direction. For each turn, draw 1 card from the Deck into your hand. Look at it but do not show it to the others. Choose to pass your turn or play an action by discarding cards face-up into the Discard pile. You can play 1 of 3 actions: Use 1 power card and perform the effect described; or, discard any 3 panic cards to steal 1 card from any player; or, discard 3 of the same cards to pick any 1 card from the Discard pile. IMPORTANT TERMS: To discard a card: without seeing the cards, select a random card and throw it into the discard pile. To steal a card: without seeing the cards, select a random card and keep it in your hand. To pick a cards: looking at the cards, pick one and keep it in your hand.

HOW TO WIN: At any time in the game, be the first to collect one of each of the five Protect cards and shout "Bye Bye Virus" without getting caught by the Police! Take note of these 2 special power cards: Use the Stay at Home card to replace any Protect card. Use the Police card to stop someone from winning. SPECIAL RULES: All cards lost due to Special Rules are thrown into the Discard pile. Maximum 8 cards in hand: To prevent hoarding, discard any extra cards at the end of your turn. Don't touch your face: Catch any player touching their face and randomly discard one of their cards.

OUR FAVORITE POWER CARDS: There are 12 different Power cards in the deck to make it fun. Government, to Create a new rule, rule breakers to discard a random card. Citizen Watch, to pick a player to recite one of the protect card's advice from memory, if they fail, steal a card. Virus Exposure, pick a player to discard 1 Protect card or to enter quarantine (skip 2 turns). Stay fit, do 10 jumping jacks to draw 1 card. And more...

Name: Glyffiti
Description:
Glyffiti is a tile placement game where each player takes the role of an aspiring spellcaster. They work together to cast a city-wide megaspell, while competing to ensure the spell fits their secret agendas.

Players take turns doing one of three actions: Drawing a glyph tile from the bag, playing a glyph tile to the board, or removing a glyph tile from the board. Each glyph has a primary and secondary element, of the classical fire, water, air, earth, or spirit.

At the beginning of the game, each player receives three agenda cards, of which they choose one to keep. This card lists how the player will score at the end of the game. They will gain points for some element types, and lose points for others. Score is based on what elements are present in the outer five spaces when all ten spaces are filled.

-description from designer

Name: Wizkrieg
Description:
Wizkrieg is a fantasy hex and counter game for 1-6 players. There are 10 human clans and 10 other races, total 20 factions in the game world. Each faction has unique heroes with various skills who may lead army in battle or do quests to collect treasures or recruit monsters. There are diplomacy features that players may make alliance. This is more like a sandbox game set in a fantasy world where players may create their own scenarios & campaigns for 1-6 players.

—description from the designer

Name: Bluffy Pirates
Description:
Bluffy Pirates is an extremely fun, highly competitive, strategic party game, suited for groups from 4 to 6 people. The game is usually full of good (and bad ) emotions, as two main key aspects are timing and, as the name suggests, bluffing.

Each round, players fight each other for one of the many different magical treasures. During one's turn, the player has two choices: either play a card with a symbol of the treasure of the round, or skip the turn, waiting for better opportunities, or simply missing the necessary card to play. Players take turns clockwise, deciding on the best strategy to win the treasure. Once a player holds a treasure for an entire turn, he gets to take it back to his ship and gains its special effect. The game is over, once a player collects 4 different treasures.

The best part of the game is when you feel like a mastermind, like you've outsmarted all of your friends.  While everyone was fighting for the treasure, you were waiting for the perfect moment to strike. Just when one of your friends was about to take the treasure back to his ship, you laugh at his face and curb his expectations, by taking the treasure into your own hands. You feel ecstatic, you are about to win the game. And just at the moment when you think that you had it in the bag... One of your friends starts laughing at your face and you very well know, what's about to come.

Name: World At War 85: We Shall Hold
Description:
We Shall Hold is the third volume in the World At War 85 series of games depicting fast and furious platoon-level combat. The game series is set in 1985, in an alternate history of World War III, when the Warsaw Pact armies storm across the border of East Germany in a powerful attempt to seize West Germany and the whole of Free Europe.

Covering even more battles on the North German Plain as well as parts of southern West Germany, We Shall Hold includes playing pieces for NATO nationalities forward-deployed toward the border between East and West Germany, or in the second line in southern Germany. NATO units are included representing the Belgian, Dutch, Canadian, and West German armies. Opposing them are units of two of the nations of the Warsaw PACT: the East Germans and the Soviet juggernaut, both deploying vast numbers of tanks and infantry in an attempt to overwhelm NATO’s lines.
Fight hypothetical battles using the stalwart Leopard-C1s and Scimitars of the 4th Canadian Mechanized Brigade Group. Deploy and maneuver Leopard-1s, Scimitars, and Milan-2 armed Jeeps of the Belgian Army. Fiercely defend against hordes of Warsaw PACT armor on the North German Plain using the deadly Leopard-2s of the Dutch Army. Assault the line with long-ranged East Germans T-72 tanks, supported by BMP-2 infantry fighting vehicles, armed with deadly Spandrel anti-tank guided missiles. Mass your Soviet attacking forces for a breakthrough using T-80 main battle tanks, more BMP-2s, Engineers for assault, and self-propelled 120mm mortars.

The World At War 85 system features a unique combat system that involves die rolls by both attacking units and defending units. Die rolls are compared and hits are applied quickly, as all the information you need to fight your units is on the counters. No combat results table is necessary. Initiative, random formation activation and turn length; direct, indirect, opportunity and anti-aircraft fire; fire and movement, assault, and close air support; all are integrated into a fast, easy to play system.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: World At War 85 (Lock 'n Load Publishing)

Name: The Great Barrier Reef Card Game: Scuba Diver Promo
Description:
3 card KS promo. Includes Scuba Diver, instructions, and a scoring card: Symbiotic.

They came in a slim plastic baggie taped to the base game's box.

If the Reef Card you played would have you pick up the Scuba Diver, you must move the Diver to any other position in the market and take the card from that space instead.

Name: Mole King
Description:
Mole king has a story that finds the greatest mole king.

The ‘mole kings’ of each country that govern peaceful mole kingdoms. One day, they heard a rumor about a land full of gold and silver, and they went on a journey to find the land of gold. As if they had made such a promise, the ‘mole kings’ of each country have gathered on the land of gold. You become a ‘mole king’ to drive out other kingdoms and occupy the land of gold. Who will take over the land of gold and become the best ‘mole king’!

Cute artwork with components and easy tile placement is the strength of this game.

Components are 61 Cards, 20 Gold&Silver tokens, 4 Makers, and 4 Quick reference Cards.

Game Setup, each player takes their color's cards(15), 1 gold token, and 1 reference card. All players flip the reference card to the other side then see the brown border that player has become the start player.
All players draw 4 cards from the deck and place the starting card in the middle of the table.

Gameplay action has only 6 steps.

     Return: Take the maker that the player placed in the previous round back to the player's hand.



     Placement: Select a card from hand and placed it. Do not place it diagonally.



     Acquisition: If the player overlapped card, then gain a silver token per each section overlapped.



     Payment: Each Player can get an extra turn by paying 1 gold or 4 silver. After the payment, each player can do step2, and 3 one more time.



     Preoccupancy: This last action of the turn. Players can place their maker on the card that the latest place. It doesn't have to be placed on top of your own mole.



     Replenishment: After finish, all actions, draw cards from the player's hand to replenish the player's hand back to four.


End of the Game, When a player uses all of their cards, the other players can no longer cover up the sections occupied by any moles as they play their cards, and the game will be continued to play until the last player takes a turn(like a Splender). The player who succeeded in securing the most mole of their player color becomes the winner.

Name: Age of Trains
Description:
Age of Trains is a retrofuturistic train game in which you aim to pick up and deliver cargo to and from various locations on the map. The game can be played by 2-5 people (depending on the map used). Finishing it requires playing through a certain number of rounds (also determined by the map used), during which we gain Victory Points. The player with the most Victory Points at the end is the winner.

The game’s mechanics revolve around the ‘pick up and deliver’ core - you plan your movement across the hexagonal map board, determine the cargo you want to pick up (originating from both private and public sector), and deliver it to the chosen city or port. The more you deliver, the more you can pick up for future transports. By buying the ‘port stock tiles’ you increase your chance of gaining more Victory Points.

Apart from the map boards (each depicting the real country with the original names on it, but  adapted to the game’s mechanics), the game also features: 
- the game board (used for determining the players’ actions, monitoring the opponent’s development, and upgrading our train), 
- the player’s board (used for monitoring player's progress and the improvements made to the train). 
The train’s upgrades are divided into 4 categories (engine, hopper wagon, additional wagons, and hiring a specialist), with each upgrade creating new opportunities for the player. Pair it up with the special cards, allowing you to break some of the rules, and you can be sure that each playthrough will differ and require the players to change their tactics and stay vigilant for the opponents’ moves.

Name: Dinosaur World: Water Pack
Description:
This expansion comes with 6 new dinosaurs species (18 meeples and 6 tiles total!) that add some aquatic variety to your games! All dinos will have heat transfer artwork on both sides of the blue translucent plastic meeple. Which of the dinos is your favorite: Dunkleosteus, Elasmosaurus, Kronosaurus, Mosasaurus, Plesiosasurus, or Plotosaurus?

In addition to these awesome components, this expansion adds some alternate rules to play with. At the beginning of the game, players will draft these aquatic dinos instead of the standard set of dinos. These tiles have special end-game scoring rules on them, steering your strategy in different directions.

The Water Dino pack also introduces the idea of algae into the game. Players will roll an additional, special die when visiting these tiles that provides algae. You'll have to clean all the algae from the water enclosures and keep your aquatic dinos happy in a clean environment or else you'll lose victory points at the end of the game!

Contents:
    6 types of dinosaurs (18 color meeples)
    6 park tiles
    1 algae die
    24 algae tokens

-description from kickstarter page

Name: Kamikaze Nanobots
Description:
Kamikaze Nanobots is a strategic, multi-player, hyper-aggressive, shoot ’em up board game. Carnage and self-destruction are actively encouraged in pursuit of victory.

The aim of the game is to destroy your opponent’s MOTHERSHIP whilst protecting your own.

Players attack and defend using SHIPS filled with NANOBOTS. SHIPS can perform different ACTIONS depending on the number of NANOBOTS onboard.

A player loses the game when a single SHOT hits their MOTHERSHIP’S core.

The game is available to print (3d printer and desktop printer needed).

—description from the designer

Hike the famous 46 peaks of the Adirondack Mountains in this fast, unique flip-and-write.

On your turn, choose a shape to add to your path as you move from a randomly-selected entry point to an exit, the same as everyone else. Your turns are simultaneous, but each shape is randomly paired with another activity- birdwatching, foraging, and more. Move past and around mountains to hike them, and gather up symbols as you combo your way to success. Show off your hiking gear through special challenges and explore specific mountains as you achieve personal goals. Along the way, use your extra water to power through extra stretches and modify your turns. The game ends on the 10th, 11th, or 12th turn, depending on if someone exits the park first. Oh, and be sure to check out Mt. Marcy for bonus points! Unique set-ups make each play different as you race to solve this pathing puzzle.

46 is a free-to-play printable game designed during the COVID-19 crisis, and will remain available here and through the publisher's website forever, with continued support.

-description from designer

Name: Monopoly: The Tank Museum
Description:
The Tank Museum brings history to life, with the world's best collection of tanks and explosive live displays. Our exhibitions tell the story of armoured warfare spanning over 100 years of history. Exploring seven powerful exhibitions, you will come face to face with almost 300 armoured vehicles. This unique collection is regarded as the finest in the world.

Take your pick from 6 exclusive tokens: Tiger I, Tog II, Mark IV, Army Boot, Wrench or Beret and race around board purchasing historic tanks and building tank sheds to drive the competition off the battlefield.

Name: Thieves' Dilemma
Description:
Who's got the money? Who can you trust?

A heist is going down. Thieves want the loot, though it’s safer if their partner is holding the bag. Guards want to recover the loot and get more glory if they recover it themselves. And a detective just wants to know who did it.

This fast-paced game is full of twists and turns just like your favorite heist movie. The gameplay is similar to Love Letter but without any player elimination. You always have one character card and one object card—on your turn you might gain information or even switch characters.

—description from the designer

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex – Necrons
Description:
The Necrons are a deathless race of alien androids, rulers of the galaxy in a long-forgotten era. Now, having slumbered in stasis for millennia, they are rising up to conquer it again. Clad in self-repairing bodies of living metal and wielding weapons that harness the most devastating energies of the cosmos, the Necrons are a terrifying enemy. Fearless, relentless, and utterly without mercy, they advance in serried ranks and lay down withering storms of fire fit to annihilate even the mightiest of foes. The hyper-resilient Necron soldiery are supported by murderous specialist units, techno-sorcerous war machines, mindless Canoptek constructs, and shards of shattered star gods. They are led to war by undying nobles wielding weapons of devastating power, driven by the absolute conviction that they are the rightful rulers of the stars. And if the long sleep has reduced many Necrons to mindless monsters, or ravaged their sanity and transformed them into murderous demigods? Such madness only makes them an even greater and more terrible threat.

Codex: Necrons is your essential guide to one of the 41st Millennium's greatest threats – a millennia-old alliance of ancient androids who long ago sacrificed their very essence for greater power. In this book, you'll discover the history of the Necrons, from the very earliest days of the universe, to the War in Heaven, and their awakening, all illustrated with stunning art. Once you've read the lore, you can build your army using a vast suite of rules that bring the Necrons to life, with rules for the dynasties (including ones of your own creation!), datasheets, Stratagems, and much, much more.

This 120-page hardback book contains:

     The history of the Necrons – from their ancient origins to the Era Indomitus
     Stunning art that brings the lore to life
     A showcase of incredibly painted miniatures to inspire your own collection and colour schemes
     Crusade rules that let you develop your Necron army in thrilling narrative campaigns
     Special abilities and bonuses like Command Protocols for your Necron forces
     Datasheets for Necrons units for your reference
     Stratagems, Powers of the C'tan, and more!


—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex – Space Marines
Description:
The Space Marines are numbered amongst the most elite warriors in the Imperium. Created by the Emperor himself from the genetic material of the demigod Primarchs, they are the ultimate soldiers for a cruel and terrible age. Inside this 208-page hardback codex, you'll find everything you need to unleash the Space Marines in battle, plus thrilling lore and art to inspire your own collection.

Inside this book, you'll find:

     The history of the Space Marines, with a look at how these genetically engineered warriors annihilate the enemies of the Emperor with terrible force
     A Space Marines bestiary with background details for every unit and Character featured
     A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
     Rules for Space Marines units that are available to every every First Founding Chapter, their Successors – including more diverse Chapters such as the Space Wolves, Blood Angels, Dark Angels – and the Deathwatch
     Rules for creating your own Successor Chapter Tactics
     Rules for upgrading your Characters to members of the Chapter Command – Chapter Ancient, Chapter Champion, Chief Apothecary, Master of Sanctity, Master of the Forge, Chief Librarian, and Chapter Master
     Stratagems, Warlord Traits, Litanies of Battle, Psychic Disciplines, Chapter Relics, and optional Secondary Objectives that define the ways that the Space Marines wage war
     Bespoke Crusade rules providing new Agendas, Requisitions, Battle Traits, Honorifics, and Crusade Relics that are unique to the Space Marines
     And more!


—description from the publisher

Name: Quiz OM
Description:
Do you think you know everything about Olympique de Marseille and you want to challenge your friends on your knowledge of the only French club that is European champion?

This quiz box is made for you!

More than 500 questions divided into 250 cards - answers  on the back - are available to play at all levels and at all ages!
Compete against your friends and family and demonstrate the extent of your knowledge about OM: the players, the matches, the managers, the coaches, the anecdotes, the highlights of the club's life, etc ...


Vous croyez tout connaître sur l'Olympique de Marseille et vous voulez défier vos amis sur vos connaissances du seul club français champion d'Europe ?

Cette boîte à quiz est faite pour vous !

Plus de 500 questions réparties en 250 cartes - les réponses sont écrites au dos -, sont proposées pour jouer à tous les niveaux et à tout âge !
Affrontez vos amis et votre famille et démontrez l'étendue de vos connaissances au sujet de l'OM : les joueurs, les matchs, les dirigeants, les entraîneurs, les anecdotes, les moments forts de la vie du club, etc...

Name: Pays de Caen: Le jeu
Description:
The game of the Pays de Caen.
From Ouistreham to Argences, from Evrecy to Troarn, discover the country of Caen while having fun.
Nearly 550 questions and photos on various themes such as geography, heritage, history, famous people, current affairs, traditions but also charades and riddles.

And "junior" questions for children, 7+


Le Jeu du Pays de Caen.

De Ouistreham à Argences, de Evrecy à Troarn, découvrez le pays de Caen en vous amusant.
Jeu de société original, local et convivial, à découvrir entre amis ou en famille..
Partez de votre commune et redécouvrez votre territoire en vous amusant.
Près de 550 questions et photos sur des thèmes variés tels que la géographie, le patrimoine, l'histoire, les personnages célèbres, l'actualité, les traditions mais aussi des charades et des devinettes.

Et pour les enfants à partir de 7 ans, des questions "junior".

Name: Nova League
Description:
Tudor Games is bringing Electric Football to the 35th century with Nova League! A new design by Brian and Geoff Engelstein, Nova League combines quick-playing modern game design with the classic fun that Electric Football has brought to generations of fans since 1947.

Play alternates between the Skill Phase, where you activate the common and special abilities of your team; and the Action Phase where you activate the vibrating board and see the action unfold in front of your eyes!

Nova League features:


     12 unique characters, each with a special ability and detailed, custom sculpt.
     24” x 13” vibrating playfield
     Because of the physics of the vibrating table, the size and shape of the sculpts matters! Place extra pieces, including missiles, ice walls, and teleporters. 
     All new gameplay that is simple, but not simplistic. Be ready to play in 5 minutes and win in 30!


—description from the designer

Name: Hoop Godz
Description: Hoop Godz brings 3-on-3 street basketball to life with this two-player head-to-head tabletop game. Pick your three players to put on the court. Spend JUICE to move, pass, and play action cards. Roll dice in real time against your opponent to find out whose actions are successful by matching icons on the action cards. Take rests to recover JUICE when you're running low. Go into the Red Zone on your turn to earn G.O.A.T. cards that give you special abilities. The first player to score 7 points wins.

Name: Coach and Play
Description:
Coach and Play Football
Deal 6 cards to each player and place the rest into 2 piles
The first player to get rid of all his/her cards wins one round
Win 4 Rounds to finish the game and be the champion
Win extra round by collecting 5 players of your team.

Gameplay
Each player places the logo of his team in front of him. The dealer chooses the direction of play (e.g. clockwise). Each player is dealt 6 cards and the remainder of the cards is placed into 2 draw piles. It is forbidden for each player to hide the back of his/her cards. After each round the winner is the dealer and starts the game.

The dealer turns over a top card from one of the 2 piles to begin a discard pile. This is the starting card. The dealer must match this card by playing the same COLOR, same NUMBER, same TEAM or same SPECIAL card. If the player wants to pass or is unable to play, he/she must pick up one card from any pile. This card can be played, or another or the player can pass.

It is possible to play several cards at the same time, if they have same number, same team or same symbol (special cards), regardless of the color(s). It is therefore possible to play combination of number and teams.

Each player can collect his/her 5 players in front of him. It counts as a played card. It is possible to place several players at the same time. These cards are not shuffled at the end of the round, each person keeps his/her own players.

The first to collect his/her 5 players wins one round but it continues if the player still has cards in hand. 
If 5 players are collected, all cards are shuffled including all collected cards from each player.

—description from the publisher

Name: Embarcadero: Unsinkable Expansion
Description:
The Unsinkable expansion for Embarcadero introduces three all-new gameplay modules and has everything you need to add a fifth player. The individual modules can be mixed and matched in any combination.

Unsinkable Ships module: This module adds unsinkable ships to the game. These new ships provide special benefits when docked. But your benefits come at a cost because those ships cannot be sunk.

Entrepreneur Buildings module: The module adds entrepreneur buildings to the game. These new buildings each count as two different card types! They also provide all-new building bonuses.

Events module: This module adds events to the game. These events, which occur twice per game, change the game in various ways, with unique bonuses or decisions for the players to make.

-description from publisher

Name: Warp's Edge: Viren Invasion
Description:
Taylor Minde's battles are far from over. More Viren forces have crawled out from the dark corners of the universe to threaten humanity once again. Will the Hive succeed in pollinating all planets? Will the Endless infest all systems with its infinite hordes? Only time will tell. But not all is doom and gloom! Taylor now has access to new skills and new starfighters with loadouts specially designed to combat the insectoid menace.

The Viren expansion is expanded content for Warp's Edge. It includes 6 new enemy cards, 3 new skill cards, 2 new Starfighter Play Boards and tokens, 3 energy tokens, and 2 new mothership dashboards and phasing tokens.

Name: Das Filmquiz: 666 Fragen zu Kino, Kult & Kassenschlagern
Description:
This is a simple box of trivia questions about films and everything regarding the film cosmos.
On each of the 111 cards are six categories for you to answer:

     Stars
     Quotes
     Popcorn
     Classics
     Direction
     Awards & Festivals


The category Popcorn consists of questions regarding goofs, adaptations, film music, voice actors, tech, technical terms and more.
Since there aren't any rules in the box, the game can be played as you like. The first one who reaches ten points wins? Why not. The first one to answer a question from each category correctly wins? Valid as well. As long as you have fun.

Name: Mint Tin Monster Mash
Description:
(EDIT 23 September 2024: this version of the game was never made, but the game is being made in 2025. See this BGG title: https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/422205/mint-tin-monster-mash-up)

A royal rumble of epic proportions in a small package.

1 - 4 players will take some magnificent creature creations and battle them against each other. You must manage your energy reserves and mutate your creatures to survive. A simple but strategic dice rolling system will see you through to victory.....or defeat!

On a turn a player will Draw a Card and Receive an energy, then they may play any combo of two actions, play a monster, play a boost or receive an energy. After every three rounds players will battle their monsters in the arena.

The game ends when a player has defeated and collected three opponents monsters.

When you have vanquished your foes pack the game back up into it's tin and put it in your pocket!

—description from the designer

Name: Escale à Amiens
Description:
Roll dice and move your pawn throughout the city of Amiens from space to space.
The goal is to be the first player to complete a schedule of activities (find accommodation, a restaurant to eat, go shopping, etc.) before arriving at the "town hall" space.
The players also have banknotes to practice all their activities. 
It's up to them to manage their expenses properly in a similar way as monopoly ...

Name: SideLinks
Description:
SideLinks is a word association game all about conceptually connecting words found on adjacent cards. It can be described simply as a cross between Scrabble and Dominoes but with words.

The game contains 140 cards with 560 English words. Each card has four family-friendly words (one per edge) and a point value between 1 and 5. 1-point cards have words with the most connections (some with over 30), while 5-point cards have words with fewer connections. But don't worry, as well over 12,000 connections are known to be available!

There are a half a dozen ways to play the game.

Players compete to get the highest score by connecting related words. For example, TEACHER can be connected with STUDENT, SCHOOL, RESPECT, LEARNING, JOB as well as a dozen other words.

Hilarious dialog begins when someone attempts a dubious connection and has to “sell” it to the group. This makes it a game about connecting people.

Other ways to play include Match, Memory, Grid, Airplane Mode, Secret Connections and Team Secrets.

This family and party game is for use at home and school as well as corporate office team building.

SideLinks is the next version of the Connections card game, renamed for worldwide distribution as we only had the Canadian trademark for "Connections". It's a new standalone game with more cards, larger cards, some new rules.

—description from the publisher

Name: Blood & Plunder: Raise the Black
Description:
This is all you need to start playing Blood & Plunder. Raise the Black will bring the Blood & Plunder universe to the 18th century and will include all new plastic kits and ships that will be fully customizable. The starter kit will be centered around the infamous encounter of Blackbeard Vs. Maynard. Everything needed to play will be included in the player 2 starter set, 2 forces , 2 legendary captains , dice, tokens, activation deck, movement templates, 2 sided player mat and more!

—description from the publisher

Name: De Boca en Boca
Description:
Be the first one to complete your start !
De Boca en Boca is a Trivia Game with questions about one of Argentina's Greatest Soccer Team. 
Pick questions among 5 themes:

     History
     Half plus one
     campaigns
     who's who
     potpourri

Name: Avanti
Description:
Avanti is played on a 8x8 grid. Each player has 16 plastic cylinders on the rows nearest them, but one is in their opponent's color and one has a pawn standing on top. The object of the game is to get your pawn to your piece that starts on your opponent's side of the board, but it can only move on the cylinders.

The cylinders move by jumping over one or more cylinders of the same color, and an opposing cylinder at the end of a line can be captured by landing on it. You can also move the opposing goal cylinder on your side of the board.

Name: Ajax competitiespel
Description:
Ajax competitiespel is played on a board representing a football pitch with the famous 4-3-3 Ajax  formation.
The goal is to be the first one to assemble the complete team on the board, as well as a trainer: 

     4 defenders
     3 midfielders
     3 attackers
     1 keeper
     1 trainer 


3000 (easy to hard) questions about the Ajax Amsterdam.

Name: Carcassonne: Bonusplättchen Spiel 2020
Description:
Promo tile given out by Hans im Glück in 2020.

No specific rules are included with the tile. The tile is simply mixed with the other landscape tiles. When a player draws the tile, he or she should place the tile according to the usual rules.

Name: Embrace Your Happiness
Description:
Embrace Your Happiness is a board game that helps you explore the happiness of yourself and others through a game.
When you know when you’re happy and how you feel when you’re happy, you won’t just wait for it, but you would actively pursue your happiness.
I invite you to this wonderful experience of discovering the happiness of you and others through Embrace your happiness.

Components are all Cards, 50 "Happiness plug" cards, 40 "Happiness on" cards, 12 "you and me" cards, 6 "you're the one" cards, 6 "help me" cards, 20 "Happiness phrase" cards, and 100 sheets.

There are two types of gameplay. The first one is the deduction game. It's a game that players guess when other players feel happy by asking questions.
Drafting "Happiness plug" cards should be three in each player's hand and all "Happiness on" cards should be open and placed on the table can see. Each player put one of their "Happiness plug" cards on the table and choose the one "Happiness on" card. After choosing the "Happiness on" card, shuffle the "Happiness plug" cards that on the table and flip all cards, and placed like a Dixit.
All players can ask the other players with their "Happiness on" card. The question should be yes or no. Only have one opportunity to ask a question. After this conversation, all players start to guess and write the name and "Happiness plug" card with matching. For every correct guess a player made, get 3 points. After 3 rounds, the game is finished. The player who got the highest point will be a winner.

The second gameplay is storytelling. It's a game that players suggest to other players the best way for them to regain the happiness they've been missing recently.
All player chooses two of the "Happiness on" cards and places the front of the player. Make a pile of "Happiness plug" cards and open the top 8 cards on the table. The start player begins to talk about their bad feeling situation with one of the "Happiness on" card. After finish the talk, the others start to give a solution with one of the "Happiness plug" cards. After all players' suggestions finished, the start player chooses the best suggestion and gives the "help me" card to the player who gives the best solution and that card is going to be 3 points. When every player gives the "help me" card to another player, the game is done. The player who has the highest score will be a winner.

Name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Hunt for the Dreadnaught
Description:
Take to the high seas of Middle-earth with The Hunt for the Dreadnaught, a unique scenario pack for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game! Rumors have reached your ears of the deadly Corsairs of Umbar. The whispers say that the Corsairs have completed the construction of the monstrous Dreadnaught, and this powerful warship now roams the coasts. Only Middle-earth’s bravest heroes have a chance to find and sink the Dreadnaught.

This scenario pack contains a full new standalone scenario, challenging you and your fellow heroes with a maritime adventure. You can play this scenario normally, with a single group of one to four players, or you can challenge the full might of the Dreadnaught in Epic Multiplayer Mode with multiple groups of players. Will you liberate the oceans of Middle-earth from the depredations of the Corsairs?

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: The Lord of the Rings – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: The Down Mail
Description:
Roll and move your train through a number of stations and signal points and complete the journey before the other players.

A beautiful example of a basic game from the early 20th century.
